metadata.Title: CVE-2021-28950 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in fs/fuse/fuse_i.h in the Linux kernel before5.11.8. A "stall on CPU" can occur because a retry loop continually findsthe same bad inode, aka CID-775c5033a0d1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28950` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-4.2.0-16-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-16-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1

linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
